commit_message:
Default image build to use yaml files

If no args are given to the overcloud image build, it will default to
using the CentOS yaml files in
/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common/image-yaml.

Change-Id: I31fe363f85a84cc4240111407829ad545e1a33cd

commit_message:
Use correct region value

TripleO is using 'regionOne' instead of default 'RegionOne',
so we need to override the default in config file.

Closes-Bug: rhbz#1357579
(cherry picked from commit 5af714c0a8843511a9ea0a9d29febd14b0a39e0d)

subject: devstack: enable tls-proxy for all -platform- jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 11:49:28.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "devstack: enable tls-proxy for all -platform- jobs

Ubuntu platforms are known to work just fine with it, as can be proved
by other jobs having it enabled and passing in the gate.

As for CentOS flavour of the job, there were some concerns around some
issues with devstack deployment with it being enabled. I just checked it
locally on a 7.3 machine, and it passes ./stack.sh just fine with
'enable_service tls-proxy', so it's not clear which issues we envision.

I suggest we enable the service for all -platform- jobs and see what
breaks for centos. If it still works just fine, we can proceed moving
that job into integrated gate. If it fails, we will deal with it, and
it's not the end of the world, because the jobs are all non-voting.

Change-Id: I322b24e69271667b0c27c8edbba1a0bcea02c525
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: enable tls-proxy for all -platform- jobs

Ubuntu platforms are known to work just fine with it, as can be proved
by other jobs having it enabled and passing in the gate.

As for CentOS flavour of the job, there were some concerns around some
issues with devstack deployment with it being enabled. I just checked it
locally on a 7.3 machine, and it passes ./stack.sh just fine with
'enable_service tls-proxy', so it's not clear which issues we envision.

I suggest we enable the service for all -platform- jobs and see what
breaks for centos. If it still works just fine, we can proceed moving
that job into integrated gate. If it fails, we will deal with it, and
it's not the end of the world, because the jobs are all non-voting.

Change-Id: I322b24e69271667b0c27c8edbba1a0bcea02c525

need to addCleanup.

subject: devstack: Have controller wait for K8s API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 22:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'devstack: Have controller wait for K8s API

There could be cases, like for example when reusing existing K8s
services where the wait_for K8s API has not run at all before the
controller is run. This would end up in a controller failure, so we
address it here.

Change-Id: Id3946e8b970a1506d70d6448cc1667fb87415134
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Have controller wait for K8s API

There could be cases, like for example when reusing existing K8s
services where the wait_for K8s API has not run at all before the
controller is run. This would end up in a controller failure, so we
address it here.

Change-Id: Id3946e8b970a1506d70d6448cc1667fb87415134
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

This fix will going to allow the usage Murano client with V3 Authentication
and multidomain environments.

Based on the latest template of RC where is used os_user_domain_name

Closes-Bug: #1600181

commit_message:
Fix Murano client to use V3 and MultiDomain Authentication

This fix will going to allow the usage Murano client with V3 Authentication
and multidomain environments.

Based on the latest template of RC where is used os_user_domain_name
instead of os_project_domain_id or os_user_domain_id.

if this variables doesn't exists will going to use the old method that was
working on older versions.

Change-Id: I420a6d825fe228279fb21bcdd5c172c9fc6369f5
Closes-Bug: #1600181

subject: Fix 'with-items' task completion condition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5558, 'name': 'Winson Chan', 'email': 'wcchan@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'winson-c-chan'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8592, 'name': 'Anastasia Kuznetsova', 'email': 'akuznetsova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nastya-kuz'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 18238, 'name': 'Hardik Parekh', 'email': 'hardik.parekh047@gmail.com', 'username': 'hparekh'}, {'_account_id': 19206, 'name': 'Dawid Deja', 'email': 'dawdej@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddeja'}, {'_account_id': 20863, 'name': 'Sharat Sharma', 'email': 'sharat.sharma@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'sharat.sharma'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 09:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_with_items.py'], 'message': "Fix 'with-items' task completion condition

* When we need to determine if 'with-items' task is completed
  it's not enough to look only at a number of action executions
  and their 'accepted' flag because this flag is modified before
  method 'WithItemsTask.on_action_complete()' is called for an
  action. This method needs to be called for all action executions
  in order to do all necessary processing (manage capacity etc.).
  This patch adds an additional check for capacity to see if it's
  equal to its initial state (which is defined by 'concurrency'
  property). This guarantees that all actions are processed
  correctly.
  This bug was leading to a invalid behavior in case of using
  'with-items' with 'retry' policy. A task would move to ERROR
  state too early so that 'retry' would rerun the task while
  some of its actions are still not fully processed.

Change-Id: I3a5d989fdf0ece0e892e4fe54f3d5debb428ff6a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'with-items' task completion condition

* When we need to determine if 'with-items' task is completed
  it's not enough to look only at a number of action executions
  and their 'accepted' flag because this flag is modified before
  method 'WithItemsTask.on_action_complete()' is called for an
  action. This method needs to be called for all action executions
  in order to do all necessary processing (manage capacity etc.).
  This patch adds an additional check for capacity to see if it's
  equal to its initial state (which is defined by 'concurrency'
  property). This guarantees that all actions are processed
  correctly.
  This bug was leading to a invalid behavior in case of using
  'with-items' with 'retry' policy. A task would move to ERROR
  state too early so that 'retry' would rerun the task while
  some of its actions are still not fully processed.

Change-Id: I3a5d989fdf0ece0e892e4fe54f3d5debb428ff6a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5558, 'name': 'Winson Chan', 'email': 'wcchan@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'winson-c-chan'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 18238, 'name': 'Hardik Parekh', 'email': 'hardik.parekh047@gmail.com', 'username': 'hparekh'}, {'_account_id': 19206, 'name': 'Dawid Deja', 'email': 'dawdej@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddeja'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 09:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py'], 'message': "Apply locking to control 'with-items' concurrency

* This commit adds a DB lock in case we need to control
  'concurrency' property for with-items. It's needed
  to make sure that we do atomic reads/writes from/to
  task runtime context that contains information about
  available capacity (number of actions allowed to run
  with the account for concurrency).

TODO:
* More testing
* Handling occuring dead locks (at least in case of MySQL)

Partial-Bug: #1640378
Change-Id: If98c3a0a66fb7b00a8099bf698ea60a4a3bf068c
"}]
commit_message:
Apply locking to control 'with-items' concurrency

* This commit adds a DB lock in case we need to control
  'concurrency' property for with-items. It's needed
  to make sure that we do atomic reads/writes from/to
  task runtime context that contains information about
  available capacity (number of actions allowed to run
  with the account for concurrency).

TODO:
* More testing
* Handling occuring dead locks (at least in case of MySQL)

Partial-Bug: #1640378
Change-Id: If98c3a0a66fb7b00a8099bf698ea60a4a3bf068c

commit_message:
Slightly improve 'with-items' tests

* Some checks in the tests rely on a number of delayed calls
  and if we need to assume that a workflow may be finished by
  the time of this check. Depending on that we can get a
  different number of calls

Change-Id: Id6557d847babf9a84c5657a13ddbe97a8142937e

commit_message:
Switch to bugfixed version of rabbitmq module

Rabbitmq provider didn't use retries for
"check_password". On overloaded and slow
environments it caused failures.

Fix for this issues is merged in upstream:
  https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-rabbitmq/pull/499
and downstream: https://review.fuel-infra.org/25553

Related-bug: #1615069

Change-Id: I27633092f7ec7b4f64196f63536f90ea86e28509

subject: acceptance: run aodh services after rabbitmq resources
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-21 08:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/aodh_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': 'acceptance: run aodh services after rabbitmq resources

Sometimes puppet-aodh acceptance tests fail due to wrong
service start order (aodh services try to connect to
rabbit while it is still unavailable).

Example:
http://logs.openstack.org/03/413003/2/gate/gate-puppet-aodh-puppet-beaker-rspec-centos-7/3cf8564/

It is easy to fix this the same way how it is fixed for puppet-ironic:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/299616/

Change-Id: Ifa17043e007ce878f9ded2b3ec65c3b8d19b9902
Closes-Bug: #1651583
(cherry picked from commit 4cf2b7f2f882e5146bd86183fd156438d6409328)
'}]
commit_message:
acceptance: run aodh services after rabbitmq resources

Sometimes puppet-aodh acceptance tests fail due to wrong
service start order (aodh services try to connect to
rabbit while it is still unavailable).

Example:
http://logs.openstack.org/03/413003/2/gate/gate-puppet-aodh-puppet-beaker-rspec-centos-7/3cf8564/

It is easy to fix this the same way how it is fixed for puppet-ironic:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/299616/

Change-Id: Ifa17043e007ce878f9ded2b3ec65c3b8d19b9902
Closes-Bug: #1651583
(cherry picked from commit 4cf2b7f2f882e5146bd86183fd156438d6409328)

commit_message:
acceptance: run aodh services after rabbitmq resources

Sometimes puppet-aodh acceptance tests fail due to wrong
service start order (aodh services try to connect to
rabbit while it is still unavailable).

Example:
http://logs.openstack.org/03/413003/2/gate/gate-puppet-aodh-puppet-beaker-rspec-centos-7/3cf8564/

It is easy to fix this the same way how it is fixed for puppet-ironic:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/299616/

Change-Id: Ifa17043e007ce878f9ded2b3ec65c3b8d19b9902
Closes-Bug: #1651583
(cherry picked from commit 4cf2b7f2f882e5146bd86183fd156438d6409328)

commit_message:
Set fixed_network_name always when ironic is enabled.

The fixed_network_name tempest config option logic was changed in [0].
It caused Ironic job to failure because ironic required fixed_network_name
to be set [0].
This patch set fixed_network_name explicitly when ironic is enabled.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374311/
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/039b2fe/tempest/scenario/manager.py#L1161

Change-Id: Iaf17b8e70b625437a486132b103989428e4666ba

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-14 17:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_block_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_2.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_common_functions.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_object_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_init.j2.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': 'Make the openvswitch 2.4->2.5 upgrade more robust

In I9b1f0eaa0d36a28e20b507bec6a4e9b3af1781ae and
I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9 we added a manual step
for upgrading openvswitch in order to specify the --nopostun

This change adds a minor update to make this workaround more
robust. It removes any existing rpms that may be around from
an earlier run, and also checks that the rpms installed are
at least newer than the version we are on.

This also refactors the code into a common definition in the
pacemaker_common_functions.sh which is included even for the
heredocs generating upgrade scripts during init. Thanks
Sofer Athlan-Guyot and Jirka Stransky for help with that.

Change-Id: Idc863de7b5a8c116c990ee8c1472cfe377836d37

commit_message:
Make the openvswitch 2.4->2.5 upgrade more robust

In I9b1f0eaa0d36a28e20b507bec6a4e9b3af1781ae and
I11fcf688982ceda5eef7afc8904afae44300c2d9 we added a manual step
for upgrading openvswitch in order to specify the --nopostun
as discussed in the bug below.

This change adds a minor update to make this workaround more
robust. It removes any existing rpms that may be around from
an earlier run, and also checks that the rpms installed are
at least newer than the version we are on.

This also refactors the code into a common definition in the
pacemaker_common_functions.sh which is included even for the
heredocs generating upgrade scripts during init. Thanks
Sofer Athlan-Guyot and Jirka Stransky for help with that.

Change-Id: Idc863de7b5a8c116c990ee8c1472cfe377836d37
Related-Bug: 1635205

subject: Add triggers and alarms for Neutron agents
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-12-20 15:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/meta/heka.yml'], 'message': 'Add triggers and alarms for Neutron agents

This patch adds monitoring of the neutron-data cluster in case Neutron
uses OVS instead of OpenContrail.
It adds new triggers for l3, metadata and openvswitch agents to
detect whether one agent is down, only 2 agents are still up or all are
down. It also adds a new AFD based on these triggers and its
corresponding GSE on the aggregator.

Change-Id: I71a4f87b66d4ef1c44efd394c2369aceed90098e
'}]
commit_message:
Add triggers and alarms for Neutron agents

This patch adds monitoring of the neutron-data cluster in case Neutron
uses OVS instead of OpenContrail.
It adds new triggers for l3, metadata and openvswitch agents to
detect whether one agent is down, only 2 agents are still up or all are
down. It also adds a new AFD based on these triggers and its
corresponding GSE on the aggregator.

Change-Id: I71a4f87b66d4ef1c44efd394c2369aceed90098e

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-10-08 06:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/test_common.py', 'releasenotes/notes/not-allow-sort-instances-based-on-joined-tables-6e1b4f588853a834.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py', 'nova/api/openstack/common.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "Should not be able to sort instances based on joined tables

This came up at the newton summit and the newton midcycle:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-newton-midcycle

But we shouldn't allow users to sort instances on any column in the
instances table in the database, which can include joined tables like
system_metadata, info_cache, extras, etc.

This is not considered an API change, it's a bug fix, since those joined
tables and internal data model can change and should not be part of the
API contract.

Change-Id: Id1a28f840bd309a0be16a07b0858aebe03cc820b
Closes-bug: #1609039
"}]
commit_message:
Should not be able to sort instances based on joined tables

This came up at the newton summit and the newton midcycle:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-newton-midcycle

But we shouldn't allow users to sort instances on any column in the
instances table in the database, which can include joined tables like
system_metadata, info_cache, extras, etc.

This is not considered an API change, it's a bug fix, since those joined
tables and internal data model can change and should not be part of the
API contract.

Change-Id: Id1a28f840bd309a0be16a07b0858aebe03cc820b
Closes-bug: #1609039

subject: Generalize tag application processes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 19:28:16.000000000', 'files': ['reference/tags/assert_supports-zero-impact-upgrade.rst', 'reference/tags/index.rst', 'reference/tags/tc_approved-release.rst', 'reference/tags/assert_supports-rolling-upgrade.rst', 'reference/tags/team_single-vendor.rst', 'reference/tags/vulnerability_managed.rst', 'reference/tags/assert_follows-standard-deprecation.rst', 'reference/tags/assert_supports-upgrade.rst', 'reference/tags/starter-kit_compute.rst', 'reference/tags/team_diverse-affiliation.rst', 'reference/tags/assert_supports-zero-downtime-upgrade.rst', 'reference/tags/stable_follows-policy.rst'], 'message': "Generalize tag application processes

Prior to this change, each tag had it's own specific tag application
process, sometimes with zero (or just inconsequential) changes in
wording when compared to a similar tag.

In order to eliminate these redundancies, this patch proposes to
generalize the tag application process on the main tags page, and allow
each tag, or group of tags, to further specify additional process
requirements (such as requiring prior approval by a group other than the
TC, or identifying the group expected to submit tag applications).

This should also make it easier to review new tags in the future.

Change-Id: I7d78dcc95ed51794c2456c827187a7087126dd21
"}]
commit_message:
Generalize tag application processes

Prior to this change, each tag had it's own specific tag application
process, sometimes with zero (or just inconsequential) changes in
wording when compared to a similar tag.

In order to eliminate these redundancies, this patch proposes to
generalize the tag application process on the main tags page, and allow
each tag, or group of tags, to further specify additional process
requirements (such as requiring prior approval by a group other than the
TC, or identifying the group expected to submit tag applications).

This should also make it easier to review new tags in the future.

Change-Id: I7d78dcc95ed51794c2456c827187a7087126dd21

commit_message:
net-conf: make bridge and interface name optional

Update the run-os-net-config.sh so that we make the
bridge_name and interface_name parameters (supplied by
the SoftwareConfig) optional. This allows operators to
create custom network templates to be used on roles other than
compute and controller which appear to be the only two roles which
set bridge_name and interface_name parameters.

Change-Id: I8997cf8177c1bf0e1f19de5f93dc4e81da1a951f

commit_message:
Auto-enable heat cinder backup functionality

This patch automatically enables heat's cinder backup functionality
if cinder's backup service is enabled.

This patch depends on a patch applied to the `os_heat` role (see
Depends-on below).

Closes-Bug: 1650035
Depends-on: I3875cc34ec92ba588d995a6d9c0341977a408ad7
Change-Id: I64db5d2bce6ac74d4d0b0f9314f3b305ac730bd0

commit_message:
Fix for VM's not getting IP due to missing SG rules

This patch set fixes missing outbound/inbound rules due
to missing SG rules due to synchronizatin issues while
adding and removing rules seen on a scale environment

Change-Id: I716f64a74add80e11e3ce7ac8641578d63eec69b
Co-Authored-By: sonu <sonu.sudhakaran@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: ShivaKumar M <shiva.kum.m@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar5@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: 1591114

commit_message:
WIP: Add functional Tests for storlet app written in python language

Therefore, this patch added the following functional test items
in python.
we use java's FTs as a reference.

・test_simple_storlet
 -> basic request method(GET, PUT, COPY) test
・test_test_storlet
 -> abnormal test
・test_SLO
 -> test using SLO
･ test_deploy_storlet
 -> test to deploy storlet file
･ test_execdep_storlet
 -> test using dependency files
・test_execqueryheader_storlet
 -> test using query or header values
・test_multiinput_storlet
 -> test using multi input

Closes-Bug: #1642542

Change-Id: Ib00589099efad4db699ccb6550d579181592e8ab

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.service.

Change-Id: I3cad0b8c3d4909b424358cf2f0bc20f80882cb33

commit_message:
[API] Add API class

Current implementation requires additional steps before api usage:
 - setting(initialization) config;
 - logging configuration;
 - etc.

All required steps already implemented on CLI level. This patch just moves
it on API layer, so users will be able to use rally api right away.

Change-Id: I806a6b5a915c751095f03ab128b41cb79ec5d3c5

subject: Add operation ID for remote calls
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-20 15:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/vim.py', 'oslo_vmware/vim_util.py', 'oslo_vmware/tests/test_api.py', 'oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py', 'oslo_vmware/api.py', 'oslo_vmware/service.py', 'oslo_vmware/pbm.py', 'oslo_vmware/tests/test_vim_util.py'], 'message': "Add operation ID for remote calls

The operation ID is a random string which can be added in the SOAP
headers of the remote request. vCenter and ESX will append this opID to
every log message associated with the remote request. This allows
administrators to correlate log messages for particular operation across
different systems (OpenStack -> vCenter -> ESX).

There is also addition keyword argument 'skip_op_id' which allows
callers to disable logging the opID if set to True.

Example for correlating logs for CreateVM_Task on devstack, vCenter and
ESX: http://paste.openstack.org/show/592614/

Change-Id: I75cb71c7c58b4ee9cd36fc977eb2a18a911f161f
"}]
commit_message:
Add operation ID for remote calls

The operation ID is a random string which can be added in the SOAP
headers of the remote request. vCenter and ESX will append this opID to
every log message associated with the remote request. This allows
administrators to correlate log messages for particular operation across
different systems (OpenStack -> vCenter -> ESX).

There is also addition keyword argument 'skip_op_id' which allows
callers to disable logging the opID if set to True.

Example for correlating logs for CreateVM_Task on devstack, vCenter and
ESX: http://paste.openstack.org/show/592614/

Change-Id: I75cb71c7c58b4ee9cd36fc977eb2a18a911f161f

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-saharaclient.

Change-Id: Ie448db6f78865a3dddadf7dc659c7546a5e0fa72

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18795, 'name': 'mkarpin', 'email': 'mkarpin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nkarpin'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-25 17:25:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/pcmk_constraint.rb', 'manifests/constraint/location_rule.pp', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_constraint/default.rb'], 'message': "WIP DO NOT MERGE location_rule constraints

pccs supports location constraints that add rules about where a resource
is allowed to run or not run.
Support for the following types is added via a new 'location_rule'
type of constraint:

  pcs constraint location haproxy-clone rule \
    resource-discovery=exclusive \
    score=0 osprole eq controller

Here is an example of the usage of the new class:
  pacemaker::constraint::location_rule { 'cinder-backup-only-on-cinder-backup-nodes':
    resource           => $::cinder::params::backup_service,
    expression         => 'cinder-backup-role eq true',
    resource_discovery => 'exclusive',
    require            => [Pacemaker::Property['cinder-backup-role-node-property'],
                           Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::cinder::params::backup_service]],
  }

WIP because I'd still like to try and see if we can subclass the
location class and not introduce a new class for this use-case only.
And I need to complete some tests with some tripleo-heat-templates using
this class.

Change-Id: I1cf6cd2eb012841e3ca5cc7e70bc7376cd6e90ed
"}]
commit_message:
WIP DO NOT MERGE location_rule constraints

pccs supports location constraints that add rules about where a resource
is allowed to run or not run.
Support for the following types is added via a new 'location_rule'
type of constraint:

  pcs constraint location haproxy-clone rule \
    resource-discovery=exclusive \
    score=0 osprole eq controller

Here is an example of the usage of the new class:
  pacemaker::constraint::location_rule { 'cinder-backup-only-on-cinder-backup-nodes':
    resource           => $::cinder::params::backup_service,
    expression         => 'cinder-backup-role eq true',
    resource_discovery => 'exclusive',
    require            => [Pacemaker::Property['cinder-backup-role-node-property'],
                           Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::cinder::params::backup_service]],
  }

WIP because I'd still like to try and see if we can subclass the
location class and not introduce a new class for this use-case only.
And I need to complete some tests with some tripleo-heat-templates using
this class.

Change-Id: I1cf6cd2eb012841e3ca5cc7e70bc7376cd6e90ed

subject: Enable tricircle commands
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-19 22:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/cmd/manage.py', 'tricircle/cmd/xjob.py', 'tricircle/cmd/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tricircle/cmd/api.py'], 'message': "Enable tricircle commands

1. What is the problem?
There is no direct way to call tricircle commands.  In consequence,
every command has to be consumed thru python interpreter.
  e. g. python cmd/manage.py etc/api.conf

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The solution is to list the new commands in the pbr configuration
file. The pdr configuration requires a valid python modules, but
given that they have implementated in *cmd* directory(instead of
*tricircle/cmd*) is required to move them. As initial phase
commands will be copied, once there is no reference to the old ones
it's possible to proceed to deprecate them.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
Replace calls to duplicate module and deprecate the old one.

Change-Id: I6a27d990803e928151ca424f47564b6626c8e99b
"}]
commit_message:
Enable tricircle commands

1. What is the problem?
There is no direct way to call tricircle commands.  In consequence,
every command has to be consumed thru python interpreter.
  e. g. python cmd/manage.py etc/api.conf

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The solution is to list the new commands in the pbr configuration
file. The pdr configuration requires a valid python modules, but
given that they have implementated in *cmd* directory(instead of
*tricircle/cmd*) is required to move them. As initial phase
commands will be copied, once there is no reference to the old ones
it's possible to proceed to deprecate them.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
Replace calls to duplicate module and deprecate the old one.

Change-Id: I6a27d990803e928151ca424f47564b6626c8e99b

commit_message:
Remove part tables from Tricircle

1. What is the problem?
Tricircle need remove some tables, we can see these tables in [1].

2. What is the solution to the problem?
This patch remove the follow tables:
*quality_of_service_specs
*quota_classes
*quota_usages
*quotas
*reservations
*volume_type_extra_specs
*volume_type_projects
*volume_types

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No new features.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/clean-legacy-tables

Change-Id: Ied0db778365fc4c8002aeb81c647ce2aae521327

subject: add new-project Picasso
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-17 11:47:26.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/picasso.config', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'add new-project Picasso

* openstack/picasso
* openstack/python-picassoclient

Picasso provides an API for Functions as a Service (FaaS).
The Picasso API server uses Keystone authentication and authorization
through its middleware.

Picasso can be used to trigger functions from OpenStack services,
such as Telemetry (via HTTP callback) or Swift. This means no long
running applications, as functions are only executed when called.

https://launchpad.net/picasso
https://launchpad.net/python-picassoclient

Wiki: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Picasso

Change-Id: I6ea8108a0524efaed4a33d2ae830ebf7138ec04c
'}]
commit_message:
add new-project Picasso

* openstack/picasso
* openstack/python-picassoclient

Picasso provides an API for Functions as a Service (FaaS).
The Picasso API server uses Keystone authentication and authorization
through its middleware.

Picasso can be used to trigger functions from OpenStack services,
such as Telemetry (via HTTP callback) or Swift. This means no long
running applications, as functions are only executed when called.

https://launchpad.net/picasso
https://launchpad.net/python-picassoclient

Wiki: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Picasso

Change-Id: I6ea8108a0524efaed4a33d2ae830ebf7138ec04c

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-20 11:00:54.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml'], 'message': "[Manila] Disable tempest for grenade job

Disable tempest for manila grenade job in proper way.
We have not installed it intentionally before and haven't added
to list of enabled services. But it tries to be updated in grenade
job. And after merge of [1] change to grenade project, that update
started failing. So, disable upgrade by specifying appropriate env vars.

[1] Idede322190d57491d4f7e18090aa8c29b5b87353

Change-Id: I1573df1fcd35564d7240efca2ec39304eb54ea60
Closes-Bug: #1650482
"}]
commit_message:
[Manila] Disable tempest for grenade job

Disable tempest for manila grenade job in proper way.
We have not installed it intentionally before and haven't added
to list of enabled services. But it tries to be updated in grenade
job. And after merge of [1] change to grenade project, that update
started failing. So, disable upgrade by specifying appropriate env vars.

[1] Idede322190d57491d4f7e18090aa8c29b5b87353

Change-Id: I1573df1fcd35564d7240efca2ec39304eb54ea60
Closes-Bug: #1650482

commit_message:
Create project rst2bash

Rst2bash is a parser which creates Bash code from RST. Install guides
will be automatically parsed to Bash and training-labs is used to
validate generated Bash code.

Needed-By: Ie38a69fb2a64216122f2a9feffdf35218356453f
Change-Id: Ibbafbaae49279acf2bf63e5cdd19b1f0433f826d

subject: Update the constraint value of schema 'ACCESS_TYPE' for Manila share
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-19 08:55:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/manila/test_share.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/manila/share.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/manila.py'], 'message': "Update the constraint value of schema 'ACCESS_TYPE' for Manila share

Update the constaint value to make it up to date. Manila support 4
kinds of access types wich are 'ip', 'user', 'cert', 'cephx', and,
'cephx' is the newer type in Manila which is supported on version '2.13'.
So update the version of Manila client to '2' incidentally.

Change-Id: I230f2bc7268e9f25f77d7b22f7a68b6ca37f6d2a
Closes-Bug: #1649217
"}]
commit_message:
Update the constraint value of schema 'ACCESS_TYPE' for Manila share

Update the constaint value to make it up to date. Manila support 4
kinds of access types wich are 'ip', 'user', 'cert', 'cephx', and,
'cephx' is the newer type in Manila which is supported on version '2.13'.
So update the version of Manila client to '2' incidentally.

Change-Id: I230f2bc7268e9f25f77d7b22f7a68b6ca37f6d2a
Closes-Bug: #1649217

subject: Error tracking and log save for wheel build
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-20 03:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/wheel-build.sh'], 'message': "Error tracking and log save for wheel build

A few things

 - failing to get the requirements file should fail the job, so remove
   skip there.

 - go through the requirements one-by-one so we can make an easily
   greppable entry in the logs for failed builds.

 - turn off verbose to make the console log managable (it's up around
   15mb) but save detailed output to a workspace log-file for failures
   (see previous point).  Requires small fix to pip [1] for --log
   behaviour.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/3586

Change-Id: Ibc4abb0ba18673791634d79c4970be965f9774e6
"}]
commit_message:
Error tracking and log save for wheel build

A few things

 - failing to get the requirements file should fail the job, so remove
   skip there.

 - go through the requirements one-by-one so we can make an easily
   greppable entry in the logs for failed builds.

 - turn off verbose to make the console log managable (it's up around
   15mb) but save detailed output to a workspace log-file for failures
   (see previous point).  Requires small fix to pip [1] for --log
   behaviour.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/3586

Change-Id: Ibc4abb0ba18673791634d79c4970be965f9774e6

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 01:02:21.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove openstackdocstheme.

Change-Id: I4ed268e3fec3754a4344c57509ff6969406335ad
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove openstackdocstheme.

Change-Id: I4ed268e3fec3754a4344c57509ff6969406335ad

subject: Refactor the source code of infra_driver/openstack
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-15 08:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/vm/infra_drivers/heat/test_heat.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/vm/infra_drivers/openstack/test_openstack.py', 'tacker/vnfm/infra_drivers/openstack/translate_template.py', 'tacker/vnfm/infra_drivers/openstack/heat_client.py', 'tacker/vnfm/infra_drivers/openstack/openstack.py', 'tacker/vnfm/monitor.py'], 'message': "Refactor the source code of infra_driver/openstack

In order to support Senlin driver for vnf auto-scaling management,
need to add auto-scaling backend switch function. But the openstack
infra_driver's source codes are using too many inner methods, that
is difficult to read, not feasible to change, and also difficult
to test. This patch refactors the source code for the first step.

* Move template translation to a separated module
* Move HeatClient class to a separated module

Change-Id: I944b3d530dcfc07d59a5efabe5cfbf788d40111a
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor the source code of infra_driver/openstack

In order to support Senlin driver for vnf auto-scaling management,
need to add auto-scaling backend switch function. But the openstack
infra_driver's source codes are using too many inner methods, that
is difficult to read, not feasible to change, and also difficult
to test. This patch refactors the source code for the first step.

* Move template translation to a separated module
* Move HeatClient class to a separated module

Change-Id: I944b3d530dcfc07d59a5efabe5cfbf788d40111a

subject: Prevent division by zero in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 15:45:02.000000000', 'files': ['test/test_pyeclib_c.py'], 'message': 'Prevent division by zero in tests

If avg_time is 0, tests will fail:
throughput = (size / 1000.0) / avg_time
ZeroDivisionError: float division by zero

This happens for me on Hurd:
https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=python-pyeclib&arch=hurd-i386&ver=1.3.1-1&stamp=1475967332

Change-Id: I0a7812977173b37918f40891f6ec0a2bc7c1d023
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent division by zero in tests

If avg_time is 0, tests will fail:
throughput = (size / 1000.0) / avg_time
ZeroDivisionError: float division by zero

This happens for me on Hurd:
https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=python-pyeclib&arch=hurd-i386&ver=1.3.1-1&stamp=1475967332

Change-Id: I0a7812977173b37918f40891f6ec0a2bc7c1d023

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 02:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py', 'tempest/common/preprov_creds.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/cmd/account_generator.py', 'tempest/lib/cli/base.py', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call. Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation 
For example: 
# WRONG 
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable) 
# RIGHT 
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I98c980a24f77a2f7746b1bd8de1826c42eb6448e
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call. Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation 
For example: 
# WRONG 
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable) 
# RIGHT 
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I98c980a24f77a2f7746b1bd8de1826c42eb6448e

commit_message:
Add metadata functional negative tests

The negative tests of metadata API are not covered enough
in functional tests. We want to add the conflict tests of
when the update/delete metadata API runs in the unexpected
state (e.g. not ACTIVE) of server.

subject: HPE3PAR: handle conflict in iscsi host create
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 19933, 'name': 'Shlomi Avihou', 'display_name': 'ZadaraStorage VPSA CI', 'email': 'openstack-dev@zadarastorage.com', 'username': 'zadara', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21990, 'name': 'Reduxio HX550 CI', 'email': 'devops@reduxio.com', 'username': 'reduxio-devops'}, {'_account_id': 22510, 'name': 'Synology DSM CI', 'email': 'cinder@synology.com', 'username': 'synocinder', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23281, 'name': 'shihongyue', 'email': 'shihy@awcloud.com', 'username': 'shihongyue'}, {'_account_id': 23613, 'name': 'NEC Cinder CI', 'email': 'nec-cinder-ci@istorage.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'nec-cinder-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 04:46:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py'], 'message': 'HPE3PAR: handle conflict in iscsi host create

One of the step in creating iSCSI VLUN is to create a host on array.
If there are simultaneous requests comming on 3par array for creating
same host, hpe3parclient creates host for first request and returns
HTTP 409 conflict error for others, with error code 73, message "host
WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host". This was not handled by
3PAR iscsi driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume
manager where it would log it. This patch addresses issue by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Closes-Bug: #1642945
(cherry picked from commit 9b0c5c4318d3c348ce185a3f4dd94f9e803bf264)

Change-Id: I102409539c9a691c1816a342163dd049855f57da
'}]
commit_message:
HPE3PAR: handle conflict in iscsi host create

One of the step in creating iSCSI VLUN is to create a host on array.
If there are simultaneous requests comming on 3par array for creating
same host, hpe3parclient creates host for first request and returns
HTTP 409 conflict error for others, with error code 73, message "host
WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host". This was not handled by
3PAR iscsi driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume
manager where it would log it. This patch addresses issue by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Closes-Bug: #1642945
(cherry picked from commit 9b0c5c4318d3c348ce185a3f4dd94f9e803bf264)

Change-Id: I102409539c9a691c1816a342163dd049855f57da

commit_message:
Add cell_v2 simple_cell_setup

As part of Ocata, nova has made the cell_v2 setup manditory for the
nova-api db sync process. This change adds a simple cell_v2 setup with a
cell0 and an execution of the 'nova-manage cell_v2 simple_cell_setup' as
part of the nova-api db setup and sync process.

Change-Id: Idfc369e9e17f7d5a30ce4ff52beb604dd4a6ac23
Closes-Bug: #1649341

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-13 07:15:33.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/l3-networking-combined-bridge-net.rst'], 'message': 'Layer-3 networking and combined bridge network spec

1. What is the problem
The current implementation of bridge networks has some problems
when supporting DVR and shared VxLan network.

2. What is the solution to the problem
The detailed discussion of the problems and the proposals to
solve the problems will be covered in this specification. This
specification will also discuss the proposed and supported
cross-OpenStack layer-3 networking model.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
The proposal to combine bridge networks discussed in this
specification needs to be implemented.

Change-Id: Ib0c3d8c31de5c2f9c1c5b08a222971ea628cc3c1
'}]
commit_message:
Layer-3 networking and combined bridge network spec

1. What is the problem
The current implementation of bridge networks has some problems
when supporting DVR and shared VxLan network.

2. What is the solution to the problem
The detailed discussion of the problems and the proposals to
solve the problems will be covered in this specification. This
specification will also discuss the proposed and supported
cross-OpenStack layer-3 networking model.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
The proposal to combine bridge networks discussed in this
specification needs to be implemented.

Change-Id: Ib0c3d8c31de5c2f9c1c5b08a222971ea628cc3c1

commit_message:
Increase func testing for ubuntu-minimal element

Since we still run these 3 version of ubuntu-minimal elements in
openstack-infra, also run functional testing for them.

Trusty and xenial will be in voting gate, precise added as skipped for
non-voting.

Add the default skip/run status to the "-l" output just to confirm
this too.

Change-Id: Icfbfd0cb7d9acae824972474b77e2fe0486c4f69
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 02:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove tosca-parser.

Change-Id: Ia9d0bee95a0541eb308d1fb273319209187ce64b
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove tosca-parser.

Change-Id: Ia9d0bee95a0541eb308d1fb273319209187ce64b

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-14 12:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/v2/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/slug-manila-type-059a1d686582e281.yaml'], 'message': "Fix manila share-type that <is> true or false can't use

All boolean extra specs in manila can accept <is> operator
to match extra-specs. However, the DHSS value and snapshot_support
cannot be set to <is> True or <is> False.

Change-Id: Id610aeafc2a17a835a632bdd0379b2a1b51ce1db
Closes-Bug: #1647781

commit_message:
Fix manila share-type that <is> true or false can't use

All boolean extra specs in manila can accept <is> operator
to match extra-specs. However, the DHSS value and snapshot_support
cannot be set to <is> True or <is> False.

Change-Id: Id610aeafc2a17a835a632bdd0379b2a1b51ce1db
Closes-Bug: #1647781

This commit adds an experimental TripleO CI job that uses quickstart and
relies on nodepool's multinode capabilities for testing in a vanilla
OpenStack environment.

commit_message:
Raise exception when create from existing volume which is being usd by another cluster

For one volume, it could only be along to one fuxi cluster,
when another cluster creates volume from it, should raises exception.

Closes-Bug: #1634402

subject: Properly distribute extra ceph client keys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 17:10:08.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceph_auth_extra_compute.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/distribute-extra-keys-d01164639ff9bdf9.yaml'], 'message': 'Properly distribute extra ceph client keys

When adding extra ceph clusters, client keys are not currently
distributed to hypervisors; This patch ensures that
the keys are properly distributed and cleaned up by ansible.

Change-Id: I3eb8fa201f4601565e88e0e68af68e9dfdadc88f
(cherry picked from commit b818c7f832d53de2c797ef3e3a4bebf9bacf910e)
'}]
commit_message:
Properly distribute extra ceph client keys

When adding extra ceph clusters, client keys are not currently
distributed to hypervisors; This patch ensures that
the keys are properly distributed and cleaned up by ansible.

Change-Id: I3eb8fa201f4601565e88e0e68af68e9dfdadc88f

revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2016-12-13 16:02:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Fix race condition in creation of fip gateway

In large-scale environments, we have seen a router update
arrive for one tenant while we are still creating the
router for a different tenant and initializing the shared
floating IP gateway port.  Sometimes these updates can
get scheduled simultaneously, with the second running
before we are done creating all the resources in the
first, causing an exception when trying to set the
default route since either the interface or IP address
does not exist yet.

Add a lock to better synchronize these functions so
a create can finish before an update can be done.

If it still fails, we will throw an exception so that
the namespace will be cleaned-up and the update can be
re-scheduled for the next iteration.

Closes-Bug: #1631513
Change-Id: Ia8c92cea2f8798582c39ad3450ab3b3c45a356f7
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix race condition in creation of fip gateway

In large-scale environments, we have seen a router update
arrive for one tenant while we are still creating the
router for a different tenant and initializing the shared
floating IP gateway port.  Sometimes these updates can
get scheduled simultaneously, with the second running
before we are done creating all the resources in the
first, causing an exception when trying to set the
default route since either the interface or IP address
does not exist yet.

Add a lock to better synchronize these functions so
a create can finish before an update can be done.

If it still fails, we will throw an exception so that
the namespace will be cleaned-up and the update can be
re-scheduled for the next iteration.

Closes-Bug: #1631513
Change-Id: Ia8c92cea2f8798582c39ad3450ab3b3c45a356f7

commit_message:
Apply unique_key to security group

security group used to allocate unique key in cache, this might
cause duplicated flows when restart df local controller. This patch
will store the unique key in nb db, so that it can keep consistent
during restart df local controller.

The way to perform nb db data migration will be discussed at [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/401210

Change-Id: I952ca6e7d9d91cdc6b3618ed45ba4d153de9c033
Partial-bug: #1633082

commit_message:
Apply virtual tunnel port to l2 app

The virtual tunnel port will not have remote ip. This patch
adds remote ip to the packet in l2 app. So that one virtual
tunnel port can be shared by multiple remote chassis.

Change-Id: I847f65bd4bae27db99a942c54d251458a8d9ba20
Partially-implements: blueprint virtual-tunnel-port-support

commit_message:
add active detection app for allowed address pairs

This patch implement the active detection app for allowed
address pairs.
The main changes are:
1) Add a struct named 'activeport' in DF DB, and it is used to save
the detected active VM port of a allowed address pairs.
2) Add a app named active_port_detection_app. This app is used to
detect the active VM port by sending ARP requests and receiving the
replies or the gratuitous ARPs.
3) Add fullstack cases about this feature.

Partially-Implements: blueprint allowed-address-pairs
Change-Id: Iaba7e719770556468bf36df56d330100361d5f84

commit_message:
Remove duplicate setup code from test_tempurl.py

TestTempURLPrefix.setUp() almost duplicates the superclass
setUp method, except it set "expires" as an instance variable.
The duplicated setUp code can be removed by simply having the
super class setUp set the "expires" instance variable.

Change-Id: Icf7604460e475523e156daa8c578765336820c8e

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 08:23:27.000000000', 'files': ['tackerclient/tests/unit/test_cli10.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly [1]. There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I6adceadb6e3749e34cf847654f28a3b6eea832fd
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly [1]. There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I6adceadb6e3749e34cf847654f28a3b6eea832fd

Fix 'No data to report' error in coverage.

Remove unnecessary commands in 'testenv:cover' of tox.ini.

'python setup.py testr --coverage' only.

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 07:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/testlib_api.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly [1]. There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I9eb823d25d3b119653f31718056576dbc59b6960
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly [1]. There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I9eb823d25d3b119653f31718056576dbc59b6960

subject: Avoid Forcing the Translation of Translatable Variables
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-15 06:28:16.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/api/extensions.py', 'tacker/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Avoid Forcing the Translation of Translatable Variables

Translation can also be delayed for variables that potentially contain
translatable objects such as exceptions.
Whenever possible translation should not be forced by use of six.text_type()
on a message being used with a format string.
This patch allows the translation of the translatable replacement text to be
delayed until the message is translated.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#avoid-forcing-the-translation-of-translatable-variables

Change-Id: I5e259368cbf135116bb3b631835227caa1825894
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid Forcing the Translation of Translatable Variables

Translation can also be delayed for variables that potentially contain
translatable objects such as exceptions.
Whenever possible translation should not be forced by use of six.text_type()
on a message being used with a format string.
This patch allows the translation of the translatable replacement text to be
delayed until the message is translated.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#avoid-forcing-the-translation-of-translatable-variables

Change-Id: I5e259368cbf135116bb3b631835227caa1825894

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 16907, 'name': 'Diana Clarke', 'email': 'diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com', 'username': 'diana-clarke'}, {'_account_id': 24215, 'name': 'Akshil Verma', 'email': 'akshilverma4@gmail.com', 'username': 'akshilv'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-19 18:09:39.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/base.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_base.py'], 'message': 'Fixed the __ne__ implementation in base.Resource

Any object of Resource class or its child class do not compare with
None as expected. For example if a server has been found and is
clearly not None, the test "server!=None" will be False.

This was occuring because the __eq__ implementation was returning the
'NotImplemented' keyword and the __ne__ implementation was returning
the not of __eq__, which in this case will return False as the
expected python behavior for a the not of NotImplemented is False.

Changed the __ne__ implementation to return the correct boolean value
and added the test case that fails with the older implementation and
passes in the current fix.

Change-Id: I6bf5a6e9c9eed4bbcf6678467df19dfea560b4de
Closes-Bug: #1648207
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the __ne__ implementation in base.Resource

Any object of Resource class or its child class do not compare with
None as expected. For example if a server has been found and is
clearly not None, the test "server!=None" will be False.

This was occuring because the __eq__ implementation was returning the
'NotImplemented' keyword and the __ne__ implementation was returning
the not of __eq__, which in this case will return False as the
expected python behavior for a the not of NotImplemented is False.

Changed the __ne__ implementation to return the correct boolean value
and added the test case that fails with the older implementation and
passes in the current fix.

Change-Id: I6bf5a6e9c9eed4bbcf6678467df19dfea560b4de
Closes-Bug: #1648207

subject: Align the stars to unblock instack-undercloud gate on stable/newton
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-20 21:43:42.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'scripts/instack-virt-setup', 'elements/undercloud-install/os-apply-config/root/stackrc', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/undercloud-install/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/98-undercloud-setup', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': "Align the stars to unblock instack-undercloud gate on stable/newton

We need to squash to patches if we want to unblock stable/newton CI.

First patch:

Fix bashate errors and warnings (lint)

Fix 1 warning and 1 error in bash syntax:

1) E043: Arithmetic compound has inconsistent return semantics.
   Fix the bash syntax to be compliant.

2) ERROR: Split export and assignments in 2 files. Ignore the files.
   Fix the bash syntax to be compliant.
   Note: this test has been introducted by
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/400542/

(cherry picked from commit 9031dcf62016c5ca198a39109425b9f063e131fc)

Second Patch:

Run `yum update -y` before Puppet run

This patch run `yum update -y` right before running os-refresh-config
(Puppet).

1) Running `yum` from an Exec in Puppet is a bad idea because Puppet has
no idea which packages resources are touched, so we're loosing the
orchestration control.

2) We need to ensure that `yum update -y` runs before any attempt to
deploy OpenStack services, so we have latest packages from RDO and
CentOS.

Closes-Bug: #1650374
(cherry picked from commit 853b4bfbadda67cf659a8a744b82d128a4bc3247)

Change-Id: Ifbbbdbf1f0c569791abc712913c7e0f6bbe533d9
"}]
commit_message:
Align the stars to unblock instack-undercloud gate on stable/newton

We need to squash to patches if we want to unblock stable/newton CI.

First patch:

Fix bashate errors and warnings (lint)

Fix 1 warning and 1 error in bash syntax:

1) E043: Arithmetic compound has inconsistent return semantics.
   Fix the bash syntax to be compliant.

2) ERROR: Split export and assignments in 2 files. Ignore the files.
   Fix the bash syntax to be compliant.
   Note: this test has been introducted by
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/400542/

(cherry picked from commit 9031dcf62016c5ca198a39109425b9f063e131fc)

Second Patch:

Run `yum update -y` before Puppet run

This patch run `yum update -y` right before running os-refresh-config
(Puppet).

1) Running `yum` from an Exec in Puppet is a bad idea because Puppet has
no idea which packages resources are touched, so we're loosing the
orchestration control.

2) We need to ensure that `yum update -y` runs before any attempt to
deploy OpenStack services, so we have latest packages from RDO and
CentOS.

Closes-Bug: #1650374
(cherry picked from commit 853b4bfbadda67cf659a8a744b82d128a4bc3247)

Change-Id: Ifbbbdbf1f0c569791abc712913c7e0f6bbe533d9

commit_message:
Add tracing flag to dib invocations

Add the "-x" tracing flag to dib invocations so we get a full trace in
the logs.  This is very helpful for debugging issues from logs.

commit_message:
Change common dependency container to convert env var names to uppercase

This ps changes the values propagated from values.yaml to uppercase for the
entrypoint init container. Which means that we do not mix case, leading to a
more consistent set of configuration parameter keys.

Change-Id: I4bdad59cbccd286f5d8d31380d9bd16965e22a22

commit_message:
Include glean to nodepool-dsvm jobs

This this the first step at allowing Depends-On patches from glean.

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ic6045a3b8dabedf3ecaa14d94707614fc4d454e4
Closes-Bug: #1082248

subject: Update tox configuration file to reduce duplication
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 17:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update tox configuration file to reduce duplication

While reviewing a separate patch in which an entire test environment was
simply copied and pasted just to change the basepython attribute, I
realized Glance could utilize tox's feature set in a much more efficient
manner.

Tox allows you to generate envlists, have "factor-conditional" settings,
and other "factor-conditional" conditions since version 1.8:
https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#generative-envlist
A good minimum version, though, is 2.3.1 because it has made support for
these features more robust and a lot of bugs have since been fixed.

Change-Id: Ia44a37177d57b972c4c9d0f179291b0c8316dd95
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox configuration file to reduce duplication

While reviewing a separate patch in which an entire test environment was
simply copied and pasted just to change the basepython attribute, I
realized Glance could utilize tox's feature set in a much more efficient
manner.

Tox allows you to generate envlists, have "factor-conditional" settings,
and other "factor-conditional" conditions since version 1.8:
https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#generative-envlist
A good minimum version, though, is 2.3.1 because it has made support for
these features more robust and a lot of bugs have since been fixed.

Change-Id: Ia44a37177d57b972c4c9d0f179291b0c8316dd95

Fix ironic_api_url value

The api_url value is wrong and causes gate failures now that the value
is tested by the ironic server when it starts up.

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2016-12-19 10:32:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rbd-v2.1-replication-64a9d0bec5987faf.yaml'], 'message': "RBD: Implement v2.1 replication

This patch implements v2.1 replication in the RBD driver.  A single ceph
backend can support both replicated and non-replicated volumes using
volume types.  For replicated volumes, both clusters are expected to be
configured with rbd-mirror with keys in place and image mirroring
enabled on the pool.  The RBD driver will enable replication per-volume
if the volume type requests it.

On failover, each replicated volume is promoted to primary on the
secondary cluster and new connection requests will receive connection
information for the volume on the secondary cluster.  At the time of
writing, failback is not supported by Cinder and requires admin
intervention to reach a per-failover state.

Non replicated volumes will be set to error status to reflect that they
are not available, and the previous status will be stored in the
replication_driver_data field.

There are two configuration pieces required to make this work:

1. A volume type that enables replication:

    $ cinder type-create replicated
    $ cinder type-key    replicated set volume_backend_name=ceph
    $ cinder type-key    replicated set replication_enabled='<is> True'

2. A secondary backend defined in cinder.conf:

    [ceph]
    ...
    replication_device = backend_id:secondary,
                         conf:/etc/ceph/secondary.conf,
                         user:cinder

The only required parameter is backend_id, as conf and user have
defaults.  Conf defaults to /etc/ceph/$backend_id.conf and user defaults
to rbd_user or cinder if that one is None.

We also have a new configuration option for the RBD driver called
replication_connect_timeout that allows us to specify the timeout for
the promotion/demotion of a single volume.

We try to do a clean failover for cases where there is still
connectivity with the primary cluster, so we'll try to do a demotion of
the original images, and when one of the demotions fails we just assume
that all of the other demotions will fail as well (the cluster is not
accesible) so we'll do a forceful promotion for those images.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint rbd-replication
Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I58c38fe11014aaade6b42f4bdf9d32b73c82e18d
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: Implement v2.1 replication

This patch implements v2.1 replication in the RBD driver.  A single ceph
backend can support both replicated and non-replicated volumes using
volume types.  For replicated volumes, both clusters are expected to be
configured with rbd-mirror with keys in place and image mirroring
enabled on the pool.  The RBD driver will enable replication per-volume
if the volume type requests it.

On failover, each replicated volume is promoted to primary on the
secondary cluster and new connection requests will receive connection
information for the volume on the secondary cluster.  At the time of
writing, failback is not supported by Cinder and requires admin
intervention to reach a per-failover state.

Non replicated volumes will be set to error status to reflect that they
are not available, and the previous status will be stored in the
replication_driver_data field.

There are two configuration pieces required to make this work:

1. A volume type that enables replication:

    $ cinder type-create replicated
    $ cinder type-key    replicated set volume_backend_name=ceph
    $ cinder type-key    replicated set replication_enabled='<is> True'

2. A secondary backend defined in cinder.conf:

    [ceph]
    ...
    replication_device = backend_id:secondary,
                         conf:/etc/ceph/secondary.conf,
                         user:cinder

The only required parameter is backend_id, as conf and user have
defaults.  Conf defaults to /etc/ceph/$backend_id.conf and user defaults
to rbd_user or cinder if that one is None.

We also have a new configuration option for the RBD driver called
replication_connect_timeout that allows us to specify the timeout for
the promotion/demotion of a single volume.

We try to do a clean failover for cases where there is still
connectivity with the primary cluster, so we'll try to do a demotion of
the original images, and when one of the demotions fails we just assume
that all of the other demotions will fail as well (the cluster is not
accesible) so we'll do a forceful promotion for those images.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint rbd-replication
Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I58c38fe11014aaade6b42f4bdf9d32b73c82e18d

commit_message:
Add image preallocation mode option

Image preallocation allows storage to be fully allocated at
instance start. This should significantly improve performance
on writes to new blocks and may even improve I/O performance
to prewritten blocks due to reduced fragmentation.

Change-Id: I1be99c9af8f32b1a7f8408ddeb695fd05a603ace

subject: Removing ironic-webclient gating for retirement
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-20 14:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/javascript.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Removing ironic-webclient gating for retirement

Per the annoucement[0] to the openstack-dev mailing list,
this change removes the gating from ironic-webclient to
allow us to retire the ironic-webclient.

Additionally, the '{name}-nodejs{version}-npm-publish-draft'
template was only used by the ironic-webclient to publish a
working draft for users to review. As it is no longer used
anywhere else, it must be removed in order to permit tests
to pass.

[0]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/109195.html

Change-Id: Ie6d940a071f158be647dd86c32752e5988d7c968
"}]
commit_message:
Removing ironic-webclient gating for retirement

Per the annoucement[0] to the openstack-dev mailing list,
this change removes the gating from ironic-webclient to
allow us to retire the ironic-webclient.

Additionally, the '{name}-nodejs{version}-npm-publish-draft'
template was only used by the ironic-webclient to publish a
working draft for users to review. As it is no longer used
anywhere else, it must be removed in order to permit tests
to pass.

[0]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/109195.html

Change-Id: Ie6d940a071f158be647dd86c32752e5988d7c968

commit_message:
use six.StringIO for compatibility with io.StringIO in python3

The newer version of six (1.4.1) provides six.StringIO
which is a fake file object for textual data. It's an
alias for cStringIO.StringIO, in python2 and io.StringIO
in Python3

Change-Id: I5f4af05eb0754d85a73068d5f6b285d4be07cdfc

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-17 15:22:07.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove ceilometer.

Change-Id: I8bdf866f0304649720adbfde1753e22ca248d432
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove ceilometer.

Change-Id: I8bdf866f0304649720adbfde1753e22ca248d432

commit_message:
Set grub timeout default

Set the grub timeout to 5 seconds by default, and add notes on how to
update this.  This will stop infra having to carry an element that
goes and rewrites the grub configuration.

Change-Id: I556b3f48eff1b67ee8c4b9b64f749af95100fb99

commit_message:
Fix LOG marker to follow the Python 3 guideline

"log.warn" which is functionally identical to "log.warning",
is deprecated in Python 3 .
we'd better use "log.warning" instead.

Change-Id: I7e09294d4b69eea5756bdc0af5facfdbe94ab364

subject: Switch wsgi test to use rspec-puppet-facts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 17:08:05.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Switch wsgi test to use rspec-puppet-facts

The apache module expects the operatingsystem fact to be set and because
the wsgi tests were not using rspec-puppet-facts the missing fact is
causing failures. This change switches the wsgi test to leverage
rspec-puppet-facts to ensure all the basic facts are being provided to
resolve the unit test failures.

Change-Id: Ic5d9bd9939ad153d92af2480742506c92acda2c6
Closes-Bug: #1651522
'}]
commit_message:
Switch wsgi test to use rspec-puppet-facts

The apache module expects the operatingsystem fact to be set and because
the wsgi tests were not using rspec-puppet-facts the missing fact is
causing failures. This change switches the wsgi test to leverage
rspec-puppet-facts to ensure all the basic facts are being provided to
resolve the unit test failures.

Change-Id: Ic5d9bd9939ad153d92af2480742506c92acda2c6
Closes-Bug: #1651522

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-07 11:14:30.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/token/persistence/core.py'], 'message': 'Invalidate token cache after token delete

After deleting a token, the token cache needs to be invalidated.
This was only happenning for persistent tokens.

This patch also calls the token cache invalidation on the token provider
so that it happens regardless of the token provider being used or if the
token has actually been persisted.

Change-Id: I496531a30559f0cf021c4478404093a99f2fbe3d
'}]
commit_message:
Invalidate token cache after token delete

After deleting a token, the token cache needs to be invalidated.
This was only happenning for persistent tokens.

This patch also calls the token cache invalidation on the token provider
so that it happens regardless of the token provider being used or if the
token has actually been persisted.

Change-Id: I496531a30559f0cf021c4478404093a99f2fbe3d

subject: Noop the updates and ha jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 17:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Noop the updates and ha jobs

Because these two jobs are always taking the full ~2:45 right now,
they're causing a huge queue in zuul, which is making it difficult
to even test patches intended to fix the jobs.  I propose we noop
them globally, and then our test patches can re-enable them as
needed.  This should keep the queue small and allow us to get
results quickly on test patches.

Note that I'm nooping them to failure to make it clear that they
still aren't working.

Change-Id: I02907f1e2c7bb82a98e7fa9f501dad751d861e6e
"}]
commit_message:
Noop the updates and ha jobs

Because these two jobs are always taking the full ~2:45 right now,
they're causing a huge queue in zuul, which is making it difficult
to even test patches intended to fix the jobs.  I propose we noop
them globally, and then our test patches can re-enable them as
needed.  This should keep the queue small and allow us to get
results quickly on test patches.

Note that I'm nooping them to failure to make it clear that they
still aren't working.

Change-Id: I02907f1e2c7bb82a98e7fa9f501dad751d861e6e

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-12-20 18:46:50.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/test_dlo.py', 'test/functional/test_account.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/functional/test_slo.py', 'test/functional/test_tempurl.py', 'test/functional/swift_test_client.py', 'test/functional/test_versioned_writes.py'], 'message': 'Make tempurl functional tests clean up account keys

Addresses a TODO in test/functional/test_account.py where
an account metadata test was having to clean up tempurl keys
in the account metadata that were left by another test in
a different module. This cleanup is necessary because tests
in test_account.py fail if there is any pre-existing
account metadata.

This patch:

* makes the tempurl tests clean up their keys from account
  metadata.

* makes the test_account.py:TestAccount class remove any
  pre-existing metadata before attempting any tests and
  replacing that metadata when all the tests in that class
  have completed. This is more robust than the existing code
  which only removes any tempurl keys that might be in the
  account - now you could have x-account-meta-foo = bar in
  the test account and test_account.py will still pass.

* consolidates some common setup code currently repeated for
  many of the functional test classes into into a BaseEnv class.

Change-Id: I874a9e23dfcdd1caa934945b46089f11b9f6de65
'}]
commit_message:
Make tempurl functional tests clean up account keys

Addresses a TODO in test/functional/test_account.py where
an account metadata test was having to clean up tempurl keys
in the account metadata that were left by another test in
a different module. This cleanup is necessary because tests
in test_account.py fail if there is any pre-existing
account metadata.

This patch:

* makes the tempurl tests clean up their keys from account
  metadata.

* makes the test_account.py:TestAccount class remove any
  pre-existing metadata before attempting any tests and
  replacing that metadata when all the tests in that class
  have completed. This is more robust than the existing code
  which only removes any tempurl keys that might be in the
  account - now you could have x-account-meta-foo = bar in
  the test account and test_account.py will still pass.

* consolidates some common setup code currently repeated for
  many of the functional test classes into into a BaseEnv class.

Change-Id: I874a9e23dfcdd1caa934945b46089f11b9f6de65

subject: Allow provision/local to run without sudo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 20:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['roles/provision/local/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow provision/local to run without sudo

In commit 379eb1b81aa900773edf85c668af2773016bea1e we added the
ability to create directories with a different owner than the user
running ansible. This had the unwanted side effect of forcing that
user to have sudo permissions. This breaks our jobs running from
an unprivledged jenkins.

Instead, we should check for sudo and only provide the extra
arguments for directory creation if it is available. Otherwise,
we use the previous simple directory create.

Change-Id: Iae38d7e460e168baa0078d782c08032b7f1520c6
'}]
commit_message:
Allow provision/local to run without sudo

In commit 379eb1b81aa900773edf85c668af2773016bea1e we added the
ability to create directories with a different owner than the user
running ansible. This had the unwanted side effect of forcing that
user to have sudo permissions. This breaks our jobs running from
an unprivledged jenkins.

Instead, we should check for sudo and only provide the extra
arguments for directory creation if it is available. Otherwise,
we use the previous simple directory create.

Change-Id: Iae38d7e460e168baa0078d782c08032b7f1520c6
