commit_message:
Remove private key from cert chain in /etc

As we use /etc as a TLS certchain store so we should remove
private key from it as it doesn't needed there.

Change-Id: I3041e8de1519395cc6018845285ed1b949225a52
Closes-Bug: #1650284

subject: Make flavor updating compatible with nova cli
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-05 09:00:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Make flavor updating compatible with nova cli

1. When modifying access in horizon, the flavor should not be deleted
   and the uuid changed. This is to match the behavior of performing
   theses tasks via the cli.
2. When no changes are made after hitting Edit Flavor and then save.
   The flavor should also not be deleted and recreated with new uuid.

Change-Id: I4387cd2106eb135d2050b9456312150644fa4e00
Closes-Bug: 1616223
'}]
commit_message:
Make flavor updating compatible with nova cli

1. When modifying access in horizon, the flavor should not be deleted
   and the uuid changed. This is to match the behavior of performing
   theses tasks via the cli.
2. When no changes are made after hitting Edit Flavor and then save.
   The flavor should also not be deleted and recreated with new uuid.

Change-Id: I4387cd2106eb135d2050b9456312150644fa4e00
Closes-Bug: 1616223

commit_message:
Add custom MTU attribute

Interface MTU control is modified (split to 'use_custom_mtu' and 'cuxtom_mtu') settings
to render a valid settings form on UI and unlock Fuel 9.2 testing.

This is a temporary solution and should be reverted after merge
of proper #1643599 fix.

Change-Id: I28ea516cfb13bd4d55e324b5299f5e71e3a858af
Related-Bug: #1643599

subject: Add dependency to openvswitch service for adding DPDK_OPTIONS
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-19 05:51:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/dpdk.pp'], 'message': 'Add dependency to openvswitch service for adding DPDK_OPTIONS

Openvswitch service is not restarted after configuring the
DPDK_OPTIONS parameter in /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch. Only
after the restart, the openvswitch will start in the DPDK
mode. Add a dependency to file modification to restart
the service.

Change-Id: I7df340ccffd723581ee043fd8f23a403fbfe46bb
Fixes-Bug: #1649267
'}]
commit_message:
Add dependency to openvswitch service for adding DPDK_OPTIONS

Openvswitch service is not restarted after configuring the
DPDK_OPTIONS parameter in /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch. Only
after the restart, the openvswitch will start in the DPDK
mode. Add a dependency to file modification to restart
the service.

Change-Id: I7df340ccffd723581ee043fd8f23a403fbfe46bb
Fixes-Bug: #1649267

subject: Use same priority for remote port's multicast flow
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-19 01:19:24.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l2_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l2_app.py'], 'message': "Use same priority for remote port's multicast flow

L2 app use PRIORITY_HIGH when update/delete remote port's
multicast flow, while use PRIORITY_LOW when add remote
port's multicast flow. This makes the update not work,
as the flow with PRIORITY_HIGH can't match.

Change-Id: I3a4a2bb8aab20fe9df36cbe7d40bd78a0cbf7591
Closes-Bug: #1647042
"}]
commit_message:
Use same priority for remote port's multicast flow

L2 app use PRIORITY_HIGH when update/delete remote port's
multicast flow, while use PRIORITY_LOW when add remote
port's multicast flow. This makes the update not work,
as the flow with PRIORITY_HIGH can't match.

Change-Id: I3a4a2bb8aab20fe9df36cbe7d40bd78a0cbf7591
Closes-Bug: #1647042

subject: New fenix project
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-09 16:19:42.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/fenix-specs.config', 'accessbot/channels.yaml', 'gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/fenix.config', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'New fenix project

Fenix is a new project for host maintenance control by having host specific
state that can be changed by cloud admin trough an API. Change will trigger a
notification that can be consumed by an external flow engine to do needed
actions, by Aodh to make alarm to user and by monitoring service to disable
alarms for host. Project can also hold any host specific maintenance
information useful to user that is not to be placed in project like Nova. Nova
can later have a link to project to provide more detailed information about
host maintenance consumable also by owner of a server instance. Project can
further be developed to host upgrade purposes with its capability to hold
information about host in its DB.

Change-Id: Ibbc69356826d746274c47a7d6e75dbc0289aa21e
'}]
commit_message:
New fenix project

Fenix is a new project for host maintenance control by having host specific
state that can be changed by cloud admin trough an API. Change will trigger a
notification that can be consumed by an external flow engine to do needed
actions, by Aodh to make alarm to user and by monitoring service to disable
alarms for host. Project can also hold any host specific maintenance
information useful to user that is not to be placed in project like Nova. Nova
can later have a link to project to provide more detailed information about
host maintenance consumable also by owner of a server instance. Project can
further be developed to host upgrade purposes with its capability to hold
information about host in its DB.

Change-Id: Ibbc69356826d746274c47a7d6e75dbc0289aa21e

commit_message:
Added cli-test for "plugin update"

The "plugin update" feature works only from newton and onwards.
We add an option in "tempest.conf" default True from newton and
onwards. The config option should be removed once the Mitaka
release is EOL.
This scenario test works only when fake plugin is available.

Change-Id: Ia841b8cf08a42e6d964ed4f696b080772e488119

Removed the "precreate_network" logic from "Create Network" workflow
and added a new RPC "associate_profile_with_network" which simplifies
the workflow and take away the dependency from Network and Subnet
workflow

subject: Use a little caching to improve performance with lots of deleted objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 10:12:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/instances/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py'], 'message': 'Use a little caching to improve performance with lots of deleted objects

In case there are a lot of deleted flavors and/or images, horizon pulls
the information from nova/glance several times for every instance. This
causes high load on respective services and very long loading times in
Horizon. Per-request caching of flavors and Django-caching of image
names improves the situation quite a lot. At least in our case.

YMMV of course.

Change-Id: Idafe67f531eee435053bc3d004ab87c240cff6a1
'}]
commit_message:
Use a little caching to improve performance with lots of deleted objects

In case there are a lot of deleted flavors and/or images, horizon pulls
the information from nova/glance several times for every instance. This
causes high load on respective services and very long loading times in
Horizon. Per-request caching of flavors and Django-caching of image
names improves the situation quite a lot. At least in our case.

YMMV of course.

Change-Id: Idafe67f531eee435053bc3d004ab87c240cff6a1

commit_message:
i18n: Makes the same use of args in ungettext_lazy

Different use of args in ungettext_lazy causes
error on import job from translation infrastructure
to horizon repository.

The use of variables in singular and plural strings
needs to be same.

Closes-Bug: #1630507

commit_message:
Add validation about fds passed over SBus

We know which types to expect and at which order according to the
command type.
Therefore, this commit add the validation check of FD for command type
in SBus.
also, we refactor SBus datagram and add SBus UT.

Change-Id: I2f73e4efcc747c421dc59288edd6ab905209a330
Closes-Bug: #1638188

commit_message:
Support purge queue -- websocket

A new endpoint /v2/queues/myqueue/purge is added to support purge
a queue, which accepts a POST body like:
{"resource_types": ["messages", "subscriptions"]} to allow user
purge particular resource of the queue. Test cases are added as
well.

Partially Implements: blueprint purge-queue

Change-Id: I5b2dad428a32270ecb3998bc3c0cfaccdf88ba38

subject: Configure DPDK options to isolate PMD cores and ovs process cores
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22865, 'name': 'Jaganathan Palanisamy', 'email': 'jpalanis@redhat.com', 'username': 'jaganathancse'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-18 06:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/vswitch_dpdk_spec.rb', 'manifests/dpdk.pp'], 'message': 'Configure DPDK options to isolate PMD cores and ovs process cores

The parameter -l in DPDK_OPTIONS is applied to both list cores to be
used by PMD and the list of cores that all the OVS threads should run
on. This will impact the DPDK performance, as cores on which PMD are
running, should be completely isolated (no other process should) use
it. For this, we are configuring, -l option with list of host cpus and
the list PMD cores will be configured using ovs-vsctl config command.

Fixes-Bug: #1649836

Change-Id: Ib95281bcbde34c18d26ee11d4e2603b267db563b
'}]
commit_message:
Configure DPDK options to isolate PMD cores and ovs process cores

The parameter -l in DPDK_OPTIONS is applied to both list cores to be
used by PMD and the list of cores that all the OVS threads should run
on. This will impact the DPDK performance, as cores on which PMD are
running, should be completely isolated (no other process should) use
it. For this, we are configuring, -l option with list of host cpus and
the list PMD cores will be configured using ovs-vsctl config command.

Fixes-Bug: #1649836

Change-Id: Ib95281bcbde34c18d26ee11d4e2603b267db563b

subject: move release step for updating constraints to after the PyPI upload
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-19 18:46:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/pypi-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/release-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/release-tools/release.sh'], 'message': 'move release step for updating constraints to after the PyPI upload

We have a race condition in the jobs for patches to
openstack/requirements submitted by the release jobs because the
packages are not yet on PyPI when the patch is proposed to update the
constraints file. This change moves the constraint update portion of the
release job to a separate job and schedules it to run as a dependency of
the PyPI upload job.

Change-Id: Idce73ca3813858050e8f64ece44e838266aaf5d6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
move release step for updating constraints to after the PyPI upload

We have a race condition in the jobs for patches to
openstack/requirements submitted by the release jobs because the
packages are not yet on PyPI when the patch is proposed to update the
constraints file. This change moves the constraint update portion of the
release job to a separate job and schedules it to run as a dependency of
the PyPI upload job.

Change-Id: Idce73ca3813858050e8f64ece44e838266aaf5d6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Bump job timeout for windmill buildimages to 60

Since we are doing a lot of IO in our jobs, bump to 60 just to be
safe for our slower clouds.

Change-Id: I1180301c7c814245bf85919410172f2c4aab9f6c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: increasing tempest job timeout congress
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 02:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/congress.yaml'], 'message': 'increasing tempest job timeout congress

Ever so often the devstack setup (independent of Congress) takes
10+ min longer than usual to complete, leading to the job timing
out right around the end of the tests, causing extra work for
infra resource and people to do rechecks.

This patch sets a somewhat longer time limit for avoid the issue.

Change-Id: I03ddc3a1ccfb26c2315453d81888170198e9a3fb
'}]
commit_message:
increasing tempest job timeout congress

Ever so often the devstack setup (independent of Congress) takes
10+ min longer than usual to complete, leading to the job timing
out right around the end of the tests, causing extra work for
infra resource and people to do rechecks.

This patch sets a somewhat longer time limit for avoid the issue.

Change-Id: I03ddc3a1ccfb26c2315453d81888170198e9a3fb

subject: Merge diskimage-builder and shade nodepool-dsvm jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-19 19:50:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/nodepool.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Merge diskimage-builder and shade nodepool-dsvm jobs

Since both jobs were doing this same thing, we can merge them into a
single nodepool dsvm src job.  This will allow us to also include
things like glean in a future patch.

Change-Id: I5eb37f5660f6eabec103df0ed719c3d431b681e1
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Merge diskimage-builder and shade nodepool-dsvm jobs

Since both jobs were doing this same thing, we can merge them into a
single nodepool dsvm src job.  This will allow us to also include
things like glean in a future patch.

Change-Id: I5eb37f5660f6eabec103df0ed719c3d431b681e1
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
